value.verse:
We have heard with our ears, O God,
our forefathers have told us, *
value.halfverse:
the deeds you did in their days,
 in the days of old.
how you destroyed nations and made your people flourish.
value.verse:
How with your hand you drove the peoples out
and planted our forefathers in the land; *

value.halfverse:
but your right hand, your arm, and the light of your countenance,
 because you favored them.
value.verse:
For they did not take the land by their sword,
nor did their arm win the victory for them; *
You are my King and my God; *
value.halfverse: you command victories for Jacob.
through your Name we trampled on those who rose up against us.
value.verse: Through you we pushed back our adversaries; *

value.halfverse: and my sword does not give me the victory.
value.verse: For I do not rely on my bow, *
Surely, you gave us victory over our adversaries *
value.halfverse: and put those who hate us to shame.

value.verse: Every day we gloried in God, *
value.halfverse: and we will praise your Name for ever.
and do not go forth with our armies.
value.verse: Nevertheless, you have rejected and humbled us *
You have made us fall back before our adversary, *
value.halfverse: and our enemies have plundered us.
and have scattered us among the nations.
value.verse: You have made us like sheep to be eaten *

value.halfverse: and are making no profit on the sale of them.
value.verse: You are selling your people for a trifle *

value.halfverse: a mockery and derision to those around us.
value.verse: You have made us the scorn of our neighbors, *
You have made us a byword among the nations, *
value.halfverse: a laughing-stock among the peoples.

value.verse: My humiliation is daily before me, *
value.halfverse: and shame has covered my face;

value.verse: Because of the taunts of the mockers and blasphemers, *
value.halfverse: because of the enemy and avenger.

value.verse: All this has come upon us; *
value.halfverse:
yet we have not forgotten you,
 nor have we betrayed your covenant.

value.verse: Our heart never turned back, *
value.halfverse: nor did our footsteps stray from your path;

value.verse: Though you thrust us down into a place of misery, *
value.halfverse: and covered us over with deep darkness.
or stretched out our hands to some strange god,
value.verse: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, *

value.halfverse: for he knows the secrets of the heart.
value.verse: Will not God find it out? *
Indeed, for your sake we are killed all the day long; *
value.halfverse: we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

value.verse: Awake, O Lord! why are you sleeping? *
value.halfverse: Arise! do not reject us for ever.

value.verse: Why have you hidden your face *
value.halfverse: and forgotten our affliction and oppression?

value.verse: We sink down into the dust; *
value.halfverse: our body cleaves to the ground.
and save us, for the sake of your steadfast love.
value.verse: Rise up, and help us, *
